I'm sure these events will be fun as well, so please come and enjoy them.

It's time to say good-bye to the Upcami series of songs by Riko Yamagishi and Shiori Yagi. We've seen a lot of different videos this time, but I, Yagi, was left with a strong impression of the guitar playing in the recording of "Seventh Bloom".
I was really impressed by the recording video of the guitar performance of "Seventh Blossom".
I don't know if it's the left hand or the right hand, but it sounds like a different rhythm.
I don't know if it's a bit strange to compare it to a recorder, but it's like tonguing.
I don't know much about guitar technique, so I thought it was very strange and wonderful.
I see... I, Amagishi, was watching the making of JuiceJuice's music video.I see. I, Amagishi, was very impressed by the making of JuiceJuice's music video.
I was really impressed by the making of JuiceJuice's music video, and I think it's wonderful to have songs that are very summery and give a sense of the season.
I think it's very summery and it's very nice to have songs that make you feel the season, like Tsubaki Factory's "I just wanted to float tonight.
Upokami is a program that goes behind the scenes of the production of the various artists who belong to the Upfront Group.
Please subscribe to our channel and we'll introduce you to the parts you don't normally get to see.
This time upcami's partners are Rika Yamagishi from Tsubaki Factory and Ori Yagishi from Tsubaki Factory.
Good bye!
